snippet: A plan by the New York City Housing Authority to raze the busy community center in the Washington Houses for private residential development has aroused concern.
abstract: East Harlem Journal; New York City Housing Authority plans to raze building that houses the busy community center in Washington Houses, to make way for private residential development; authority says center’s operations will not be interrupted even if it is relocated, but some residents are skeptical that the center, which has been turning lives around for more than 55 years, will survive.
lead_paragraph: A plan by the New York City Housing Authority to raze the busy community center in the Washington Houses for private residential development has aroused concern.

headline.seo: East Harlem Residents Fear Private Development in City-Owned Complex
headline.main: Private Development Feared in City-Owned Complex
headline.print_headline: In a City-Owned Complex, Fears of Private Development
